title: Citizen Journalism: Everyone's a Reporter
description: A 60-second lesson on Citizen Journalism: Everyone's a Reporter.

hook.text: A bystander live-streamed a police incident. The video, seen by millions, sparked a global movement.

buildup.text: Smartphones turned billions of people into potential reporters.

discovery.text: The Arab Spring was documented largely by citizens â€” not journalists.

twist.text: Citizen journalism is powerful but unvetted. Without editorial standards, it can spread unverified claims as fast as.

climax.text: The future of media is hybrid: professional journalists verifying and contextualizing citizen-captured content.

punchline.text: Everyone can report. Not everyone can verify. Both skills matter.

quiz.question: What is a key limitation of citizen journalism?
options: Lack of editorial standards and verification
